dict.acceptation: 空想的，异想天开的；奇异的，古怪的；极好的；不切实际的；

sent.orig: It has a fantastic cast-the ensemble acting group is fantastic-but primarily the writing is so sound.
sent.trans: 它还有一流的演员——演员阵容简直没的说——但是，最根本的是剧本就非常完美。

sent.orig: And you, when you have three are fantastic, you call it a fantastic Super Bowl.
sent.trans: 你，当你有三幕精彩表现时，你可以称比赛为精彩的超级碗。

sent.orig: Abigail: Fantastic. I heard a couple of the tracks on the radio yesterday. They were amazing.
sent.trans: 艾比盖尔：好啊。我昨天在收音机上听到其中几首歌，非常好听。

sent.orig: Author of Fantastic Beasts and Where To Find Them (SS5) and a number of other books.
sent.trans: 《神奇动物在哪里》等书的作者（魔法石，第5章）。

sent.orig: AIt's a fantastic piece of architecture.
sent.trans: 它确实是一项令人惊叹的建筑。
